# Recommended Readings:

- [<i class="fas fa-file-pdf"></i> Coase (1937), "The Nature of the Firm"](/readings/Coase-1937.pdf)
- [<i class="fas fa-external-link-square-alt"></i> Munger (2007), "I'll Stick With These: Some Sharp Observations on the Division of Labor"](https://www.econlib.org/library/Columns/y2007/Mungerpins.html)
- [<i class="fas fa-external-link-square-alt"></i> Smith (1776), *Wealth of Nations*, Book I, Chs. 1-3](https://www.econlib.org/library/Smith/smWN.html)
- [<i class="fas fa-file-pdf"></i> Stigler (1951), "The Division of Labor is Limited by the Extent of the Market"](/readings/Stigler-1951.pdf)

The free IO textbook does a good job covering the theory of the firm in Chapter 3:

- <i class="fas fas fa-book"></i> Ch. 3.2 in @Church^[Again, there is [a free PDF](https://works.bepress.com/jeffrey_church/23/) from the authors.]

Much of the rest of their discussion in Chapter 3 we will cover over the next few classes (asset specificity theory, vertical integration, etc.)
